concept.title: Example of an XDITA map
concept.shortdesc: The following map is authored in XDITA.

conbody.codeblock: <map id="remote-main"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Remote Lighting Network</navtitle> </topicmeta> <keydef keys="product-name"> <topicmeta> <linktext>Remote Network Lighting</linktext> </topicmeta> </keydef> <topicref href="introduction.dita"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Introduction</navtitle> </topicmeta> </topicref> <topicref href="alternatives.dita"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Alternative lighting setups</navtitle> </topicmeta> <topicref href="low-power.dita"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Low power installation</navtitle> </topicmeta> </topicref> <topicref href="high-power.dita"> <topicmeta> <navtitle>High power installation</navtitle> </topicmeta> </topicref> </topicref> </map>
conbody.p: Note that XDITA requires a navtitle inside a topicmeta to declare a map's title. This decision eliminates the need for title as a single-purpose element in maps, and also keeps the topicmeta options parallel for maps and topics.
